title: Compare 15th c French Italian domestic arch

content.question: This question is based on one or two slides. For a question involving two slides, when you are not asked specifically to name the artists and/or titles of the works, you may refer to the work on the left as (L) and the work on the right as (R). A response that answers the question directly will receive a higher score than one that simply lists characteristics or includes irrelevant points. Both of the residences shown were built for wealthy merchants in the mid-fifteenth century. The building on the left is French, and the building on the right is Italian. Discuss and account for the differences between these buildings.

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.4: Purpose and Audience in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. form.  b. style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
